reviews.text: Only visited, used the train. Why are there so few Carriages but loads of people, who have bought a ticket for a seat, won't have a seat because the world and it's wife got on this train. The capacity standing is dangerous. The station very basic, does not cater for people if they need a lift, there is only a ticket machine and steps.

What a lovely little traditional train station 

Ideal for journeys to Shrewsbury and beyond to Wales

Furthermore there are direct trains to Manchester Piccadilly the other way .. yes direct trains 

Just outside the station is the centre of Nantwich that makes this station ideal

Two platform local railway station on the line between Crewe and Shrewsbury. Hourly services in both directions.  There is a ticket vending machine on one of the platforms.  Very basic facilities although they have some nice floral displays.

Pretty flower tubs and baskets, plenty of public seats on the square, pedestrian only areas, a beautiful parish church, independent retailers, fresh produce market Tuesday morning Thursday and Saturday, a programme of special markets ...farmers, antiques, artisans, flowers,.... music and food festivals and civil war re-enactment in January. Street cafes and quiet buskers.
